body_html:
Unfortunately, it is not that simple.
We are staying with the earliest ubuntu version nvidia docker supports, which is ubuntu 16.04.
On ubuntu 16, python3.6 is not available.
Since we also had problems with 3rd party python distros before, until we upgrade the docker container to a newer version of ubuntu we will stay with python 3.5.

Just to check, is this breaking you by not having python3.6? I just would like to see if there is a specific usecase you had in mind?

body:
Unfortunately, it is not that simple.
We are staying with the earliest ubuntu version nvidia docker supports, which is ubuntu 16.04.
On ubuntu 16, python3.6 is not available.
Since we also had problems with 3rd party python distros before, until we upgrade the docker container to a newer version of ubuntu we will stay with python 3.5.

Just to check, is this breaking you by not having python3.6? I just would like to see if there is a specific usecase you had in mind?
